intro: Kadenicarpus pseudomacrochele subsp. minimus, commonly known as the minute false macrochele, is a rare and specialized plant species within the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and unique floral structure, which includes a complex arrangement of bracts and reduced petals. The plant exhibits a herbaceous growth habit and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. Its reproductive structures are adapted for specific pollinators, contributing to its ecological niche. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
